intro: Hieraciodes sieberi, commonly known as the Sieber's hiera, is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. It is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in Kazakhstan and the Tian Shan. The plant features slender, branching stems covered in fine, hairy leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are typically small and yellow, arranged in dense, flat clusters that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
